sentence: Looking back, banks and policymakers in the 1960s were grappling with significant problems created by the growth of economic activity relative to our ability to process paper payments and other financial instruments.
In this complex environment, it is hardly surprising that the overall demand for electronic payments to replace a well-functioning paper-based system has tended to grow more slowly than anticipated.
Yet over the past ten years, there has also been a good deal of growth in the use of electronic payments both as a share of noncash payments and on a per capita basis.
